description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"4al0s","text":"Cell viability after incubation with different electroporation buffers, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d16pp","text":"Phosphate buffered saline (PBS) is used as an electroporation buffer for many eukaryotic cells. However, we observed that the PBS has a detrimental effect on the cell, causing disruption in H. palaeformis cell membrane. We then tested the tolerance of H. palaeformis to three different electroporation buffers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":190,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":252,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kle4","text":"A-Gene Pulser Electroporation Buffer(BIO-RAD, USA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43aup","text":"B-Iso-osmolar Buffer (Eppendorf, USA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":20,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9ltr","text":"C-Hypo-osmolar Buffer (Eppendorf, USA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj5pi","text":"Cells were incubated in each buffer independently for 10 minutes and observed for their viability under inverted microscopy. For all the three tested buffers, we noticed that once buffer was added, the cells showed instant osmic shock, include loss of motility and relative shrinking in the cell membrane (Fig. 1). After 10 minutes incubation period in each buffer, cells were transferred to their Cerophyl culture medium to recover. We observed progressive recovery of the cells. Table 1 shows the time that took the cells to completely recovered and the percentages of the recovered cells after incubation at the three different electroporation buffers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gd7s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vt84","text":"Table 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5paee","text":"     Electroporation   buffer       Duration   of recovery      Percentage   of the recovered cells        Gene   Pulser       10   minutes      >90%        Iso-osmolar         10   minutes      70%        Hypo-osmolar      2-5   minutes      70%   ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":249}],"data":{}},{"key":"vjgb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cucq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sm53","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1mg0b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eb553","text":"Fig.1. Light microscopy images showing the effect of the different electroporation buffer on the H. palaeformis cell membrane; PBS has detrimental effect on the cell causing disruption of cell membrane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9hc2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p06m","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvo6q","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fv0f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95iis","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hbft","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s87g","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egv5k","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpm7v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[118,133,104],"data":[["  Electroporation
